pullRequest.body:
Since `Submodule.(co)map` take a `SemilinearMapClass`, it is not necessary to coerce a `LinearEquiv` to a `SemilinearMap` before applying them.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

nodes.body:
### PR summary [75f2fa19ee](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17474/commits/75f2fa19ee531bdd70664863cdca71838cabfa7c)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ comap_semilinearMap`
`+ map_semilinearMap`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

> The downside of this approach (or arguably, of the fact these defs assume `LinearMapClass` is that it's now much harder to use `map_comp` to combine `map f (map e S)`.

I introduced `(co)map_semilinearMap` for this purpose, but it seems to be more convenient to replace `rw` with `erw` to fix those breakages concerning `map_comp` ...

Unfortunately there's still a test failure that I have no idea about:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0fec8f6a-d018-4490-8a6c-d82e8505789d)
That's a test I added recently, that checks that tactics stop quickly when you tell them to. I don't see how this PR could have affected it, so rerunning should suffice.
I personally prefer removing the use of `*MapClass` in defs because they cause annoying defeq check issues e.g. the problem Eric mentioned above, resulting in `simp` or `rw` not firing correctly.
The downside of this approach (or arguably, of the fact these defs assume `LinearMapClass` is that it's now much harder to use `map_comp` to combine `map f (map e S)`.
The downside of this approach (or arguably, of the fact these defs assume `LinearMapClass` is that it's now much harder to use `map_comp` to combine `map f (map e S)`.

```suggestion
  __ := ((e : M →ₛₗ[σ₁₂] M₂).domRestrict p).codRestrict (p.map e) fun x ↦ ⟨x, by simp⟩
```

mathlib3#16105 was the PR that made `Submodule.(co)map` accept `SemilinearMapClass`, and the author @dupuisf explained his motivation [there](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib3/pull/16105#issuecomment-1219588209). Overall indeed I don't see much advantage of this generality, and it seems to me that using the coercion to `SemilinearMap` would be good enough. So my plan now is to leave this PR to you (Edit: I mean everyone in this discussion other than myself) and make my other PR independent of this one. Let me also bring the reviewer of the original PR @Vierkantor to the discussion.

The change (in Lean 3) required specifying the type of `involute` here, but now it's no longer necessary (if you write `involte.toLinearMap` it still works, so this is something we can golf regardless of the decision whether to remove the `.toLinearMap`. One could be tempted to replace `.toLinearMap` by coercions, but then you probably have to specify the type. IIRC the distinction between `.toLinearMap` and coercion can require `erw`s.

pullRequest.title: chore: remove confounding coercions from `Submodule.(co)map`

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: define finite length modules and show equivalence with `IsNoetherian ∧ IsArtinian`

I introduced `(co)map_semilinearMap` for this purpose, but it seems to be more convenient to replace `rw` with `erw` to fix those breakages concerning `map_comp` ...
